snippet: House Republicans want to starve mass transit while doing even more for Big Oil. The House bill needs to be revised. If it passes, the Senate must stop it.
abstract: Editorial contends that proposed $260 billion transportation bill is such a terrible piece of legislation that it may not pass the Republican-dominated House, despite Speaker John Boehner's imprimatur; outlines the extensive infrastructural and environmental dangers the bill's passage would create; notes the bill, which neglects mass transit, would be particularly painful for urban areas such as New York City.
lead_paragraph: House Republicans want to starve mass transit while doing even more for Big Oil. The House bill needs to be revised. If it passes, the Senate must stop it.
